title: Moksha
summary: Moksha (/ˈmoʊkʃə/; Sanskrit: मोक्ष, mokṣa; Tamil: vīdupēru), also called vimoksha, vimukti and mukti,[1] is a term in Hinduism, Buddhism, Jainism and Sikhism for various forms of emancipation, enlightenment, liberation, and release.[2] It refers to freedom from dukkha and saṃsāra, the cycle of death and rebirth,[3] by knowledge of the true self (Atman-jnana),[4] c.q. the lack of a permanent essence, and the release from craving and clinging to passions and the mundane mind.
